messages.content: What is the purpose of the Consistency Decoder in ComfyUI?
The Consistency Decoder is a custom node in ComfyUI that uses the OpenAI VAE model to maintain consistency in generated images.
Where should the downloaded OpenAI VAE model be placed for use with the Consistency Decoder?
After downloading the OpenAI VAE model, it should be placed in the 'model/vae' directory for use with the Consistency Decoder.
What is the file name of the OpenAI VAE model used by the Consistency Decoder?
The file name of the OpenAI VAE model used by the Consistency Decoder is 'decoder.pt'.
Is there an example workflow available for the Consistency Decoder in ComfyUI?
Yes, there is an example workflow available for the Consistency Decoder in ComfyUI, which can be found in the 'workflow.json' file.
What is the source of the OpenAI VAE model used by the Consistency Decoder?

The OpenAI VAE model used by the Consistency Decoder is sourced from the OpenAI public repository on Azure Edge (https://openaipublic.azureedge.net/diff-vae/c9cebd3132dd9c42936d803e33424145a748843c8f716c0814838bdc8a2fe7cb/decoder.pt).
Is the Consistency Decoder a standalone application or a part of ComfyUI?
The Consistency Decoder is not a standalone application; it is a custom node or extension that is part of ComfyUI.
Can the Consistency Decoder be used without downloading the OpenAI VAE model?
No, to use the Consistency Decoder in ComfyUI, you need to download the OpenAI VAE model and place it in the designated 'model/vae' directory.
